ISSUE.TITLE: support block lists
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ... both fetching them and covering then to mf2. lots of details in snarfed/bridgy#473. first step is to catalog each silo's feature(s), API support, and link(s) to docs. twitter is the main (only) silo people like @voxpelli @kevinmarks @kylewm have been asking for so far. - [x] twitter: can [read](https://dev.twitter.com/rest/reference/get/blocks/list) and [write](https://dev.twitter.com/rest/reference/post/blocks/create) both [blocks](https://support.twitter.com/articles/117063) (semi-private) and [mutes](https://support.twitter.com/articles/20171399) (private) - facebook: looks like no API support for reading/writing [blocks](https://m.facebook.com/help/131930530214371) - google+: nothing in the API [Person object reference](https://developers.google.com/+/web/api/rest/latest/people#resource-representations) - Instagram: nothing [in the API](https://www.instagram.com/developer/endpoints/). might be scrapable, which we're doing already for photos etc, but meh. - Flickr: [the API is big](https://www.flickr.com/services/api/), but i didn't see anything about [blocks](https://help.yahoo.com/kb/flickr-for-desktop/block-flickr-sln7464.html) or mutes. @kylewm can correct me if I'm wrong. another first step is to nail down the AS and mf2 representations we want.
